intro: Dianthus serrulatus var. strictus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved campion, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring erect, branched stems. The plant produces clusters of small, pink to purple flowers with five petals, blooming from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow, serrated, and arranged alternately along the stems. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens and borders.
